p: Thionins can rapidly permeabilize fungal membranes, as indicated in fluorescent dye experiments [ 38]. Previous studies have reported antifungal activity against C. albicans for the nigellothionins NsW1 and NsW2 [ 11]. Here, four pathogenic yeast isolates were subjected to NsW2 treatment, and three of them were sensitive to peptide action. The anti-yeast activity of thionins is established. S. cerevisiae is also used in functional studies as a model organism [ 38]. In contrast, so-called plant Î³-thionins, which have been classified into the defensin family, have anti-yeast activity [ 39]. This study is the first report of thionin activity against clinical yeast isolates.
